comment: Dr. Kim was okay. Hard to understand & her lectures were very repetitive and boring. There are 4 Assignments in her class & her assignments were repetitive. She grades strictly by her rubric so make sure u follow her rubrics for all her assignments. I felt like I have learned nothing but assessments & learning targets in her class. But she is sweet
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Kim is a great professor who truly cares about the class and the teaching profession. I appreciated the quick feedback she gave on all assignments. You MUST follow the rubrics in order to receive good grades. She is very specific about references and other requirements.

Dr. Kim is so sweet and caring. She grades straight from the rubric, but the rubric normally has more requirements than what the assignment description is. You get points for coming to class. Normally lets out early. Can be a tough grader and cares about participation.

Dr. Kim is a solid choice! She is very caring and knowledgeable about what she teaches. However, pay attention to the rubrics! It is often that more is expected of you than is on assignment directions.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Graded by few things--Tough grader

comment: Dr. Kim is so sweet and caring! She grades right from the rubrics. Follow them and you should be fine. 20 hrs field experience in Pre-K. Need to plan/teach a lesson and create a parent project for students. Also need to complete observations. There were also a couple of projects outside of field experience. You won't regret taking her!

Such a sweet and kind lady, but you cannot understand her. She has extremely broken english and many of her assignments are poorly transcripted. Not retaking her. :( Its such an in depth class and i feel it would be better with a different professor.
